meanings.definition: A nearly level land surface produced by erosion over a long period of time.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the peneplanes in the valley.
meanings.sent2: The hiker walked across the vast peneplanes with ease.
meanings.sent3: The cows grazed peacefully on the gentle peneplanes.
meanings.sent4: The peneplanes stretched out like a calm ocean of land.
meanings.sent5: The view from the top of the peneplanes was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: To smooth or level off a surface through erosion.
meanings.sent1: The river peneplanes the rocks over time.
meanings.sent2: The wind and rain peneplanes the mountain peaks.
meanings.sent3: The sculptor peneplanes the marble into a beautiful statue.
meanings.sent4: Time peneplanes memories into a smooth surface.
meanings.sent5: The constant flow of water peneplanes the riverbed.
